snippet: While a Supreme Court ruling clarified the proper standard for new counsel in capital cases, it is also a reminder that the horror of the death penalty continues.
abstract: Editorial concurs with Supreme Court ruling defining the standards federal courts use to grant new counsel to indigent defendants in death penalty cases, but contests decision to deny fresh counsel to California defendant Kenneth Clair; holds ruling will bring clarity to future cases but it is also a reminder that the horror of the death penalty continues in California and elsewhere in the country.
lead_paragraph: While a Supreme Court ruling clarified the proper standard for new counsel in capital cases, it is also a reminder that the horror of the death penalty continues.
